alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kit Carson County through 600 PM MDT... At 523 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Seibert, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Kit Carson County. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 405 and 418. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
